newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian lorry plunges into river, 35 dead.
newsitem.headline: Indian lorry plunges into river, 35 dead.

text.p: Thirty-five people in a wedding party were drowned when a lorry plunged into a swollen river in the southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh, police said on Sunday.
Police said the accident occurred on Saturday when the overcrowded lorry, carrying about 70 people, somersaulted from a bridge at Cuddapah, 400 km (250 miles) south of Hyderabad, the state capital.
The dead included 15 women and 10 children.
The state's relief commissioner, H.S. Brahma, told Reuters that rescue teams were still trying to retrieve bodies from the river, which was swollen by floodwaters. Survivors had waded ashore.
People often travel by lorry to weddings in India, where an estimated 50,000 people die in road accidents each year.
